bibl.title: Pliny the Elder and Standardized Roll Heights in the Manufacture of Papyrus.
bibl.note: PLINY, Hist. Nat. XIII, 74-78. Latitudo refers to the width of the sheet; the height of the roll is not mentioned. Buyers could count on the grades to indicate the quality of the papyrus; but the height would be a consideration quite outside of the grading itself. - Pp. 49-50: Appendix. Width and Height of Extant Papyrus Sheets.
bibl.seg: JOHNSON William A., Pliny the Elder and Standardized Roll Heights in the Manufacture of Papyrus.
